reviews.text: Good things: staff is super nice, has a coin laundry downstairs (to clean own clothes mid-trip), great location, the beds were good to sleep on, the fold out couch was not very comfy, lots of space in the room, hotel gave guest a free nylon pouch, easy to get big beach towels to bring to the beach (just have to sign them out at the front desk).
reviews.title: Good hotel location

reviews.text: Bad things: cost of parking is expensive (but average for the area), pool is shaded by the building most of the day which makes the pool very cold (children didn't like the pool so cold), the furniture/aesthetics of the place was a little dated.
reviews.title: Walking distance to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free wi-fi throughout the hotel, although I had a problem on the 3rd day getting wi-fi in my room, the staff took note and said they would look into it. Desk staff and Bell desk very helplful. I stayed 5 days (2 days on 7th floor and 3 days on 17th floor) and had a kitchenette each time, which was ideal. Both rooms were extremely quiet, surprisingly. The supermarket is just around the corner, so easy to stock up and save money on eating out. There is also a laundromat around the corner and only 3 blocks from the beach. There is a convenience store right next door and a very good restaurant also next door. The Ross store is also only 3 blocks away for some great shopping. Also a free shuttle bus around the corner for hotel guests. Overall, clean, well-priced and convenient. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: great location but nothing fancy

reviews.text: hotel is quite old but service is excellent, from lobby staff to bell desk, always ready to answer questions and very courteous. They upgraded us to a kitchenette (only microwave & sink no stove but still handy) without charge and we had the 17th floor. Great view, 2 balconies and quiet considering it's right in the hub of things. Major issue is the bathroom, we read from other reviews but it's smaller than we had expected. Very hard to have a shower even for a small person. Close to everything so definitely A1 on the location aspect.
reviews.title: hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing fancy about this hotel...but it is clean, only a couple of blocks to the beach, close to all amenities, reasonably priced. There during spring break, so quite noisy with groups of students from Oz visiting...since internet only available in the lobby....packed and noisy with students doing email/facebook, etc.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Comfortable rooms, close to the beach and the staff were fantastic. I would stay there again if i ever went to hawaii again. Also the concierge desk has plenty of information and broachers.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The only thing was that was a bit of disappointment was that 2 of the in our party were on a different floor but it was spring break and not much could be done about that
reviews.title: Mother and her 16 year old son

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and I went March 14 til the 22nd We had a kitchenette with everything we could need from a little fridge, stove top, and microwave. The house keeper for the 3rd floor was excellent. A pleasure to be greeted by in the hall. Our room was cleaned perfect each day. The staff all around were very pleasant. We were leaving late that night and they offered to keep our bags and offer a complimentary room to freshen up before we left to the airport. That was so good for us since we wanted to make the best of our last day. For children of all ages, you are a couple of short blocks away from the beautiful beach, walking distance to the zoo, aquirum and the gorcery was just around the block. Many places to eat and shop. It was just a little noisy at night as we are not night hawks but early risers and they accompidated for that. It was perfect!
reviews.title: Ohana East

reviews.text: This was a very convenient location. I was with a group and stayed here five nights recently. Initially, my room was not as I had requested. The front desk staff cheerfully changed me the next morning. The staff was very pleasant. The bathroom was very small. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Value for Waikiki
Good value, great location, friendly staff
reviews.text: This Ohana is in a great location for beach, shops, restaurants, bus service. Our room had a partial ocean-view with kitchen, but prices for food are reasonable, so we didn,t use the kitchen. Save your money, stay here and enjoy a little extra spending cash

The room with kitchentte was very small, COLD water in the shower. Kitchentte was very small and useless. We checked out after one day and for the smae price went to a 4.5 star hotel 100 meters away from it. Very bad hotel. If you can, stay away from it. Does not worth your money.
reviews.title: Is NOT worth your money!!!

reviews.text: We stayed in a one-bed kitchenette originally allocated a room on the 6th floor, due to a problem with the refridgerator we were fortunately moved to a room on the 12th floor, the views and the noise levels were so much better from there.
reviews.title: Conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent and the security was good, we felt quite safe. The front desk staff were friendly, we didn't really have any hassles to complain about.
reviews.title: Awesome Value! Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kitchenette was not great, would not have attempted to cook a meal there, good to have a full sink and microwave, we had to ask for a jug as we are not coffee drinkers.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Decide to stay here on a quick trip out to Waikiki. The Location of the hotel is very convenient to the beach, Kalakaua Ave and International Market place which are short walks, less than 10 minutes. The room we stayed in face diamond head with a balcony. The room itself was good and spacious enough for three adults. The front desk was very helpful, quick and friendly whenever we were up there and was on the ball, housekeeping was great too and very delightful even after I left my key in the room. All in all a great place to stay and great location, will be staying here again when I am back in Hawaii. Aloha.
reviews.title: Nice spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the convenience of this hotel location. Just a block from Waikiki Beach and close to shopping and entertainment. Our room was right next to the elevator and the noise from it kept us awake. Earplugs solved that problem. The room was small with an odd floor plan that did not lend itself to comfort or convenience and the bed was VERY hard. We had a hard time finding outlets to plug in our electronics. Our view was of a noisy alley so we were not inclined to spend any time on the tiny balcony. The staff was pleasant and accommodating and the room was clean. The entire hotel could use some updating. As part of a travel group, I am not aware of the individual cost for this room. All things being equal, this makes a good home base from which to see Honolulu and Waikiki. One additional benefit is free rides on the local trolley. Once we figured out where to catch the trolley, it proved to be a significant benefit.
reviews.title: Good location and pleasant staff

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great spot right in the heart of Waikiki. The famous beach is a few blocks away, as well as the International Market. All the restaurants and shopping one could want are right there. The lobby is slightly cramped but comfortable enough. Check-in was fast and pleasant. The concierge was a bit inexperienced but helpful. Parking was OK once one locates the entrance. The coffee shop service was a bit slow but served up one the best lattes I've ever had. We weren't fortunate enough to get a beach view but the 7th-floor view was nice anyway. The room was big enough, clean and well-serviced. Despite all the choices available, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend to my friends. The Aloha spirit is alive and well.
reviews.title: Heart of Waikiki

reviews.text: We were with a tour group that stayed here for 5 nights. You may want to stay on the beach when in Waikiki, but let me tell you this hotel is in a great location as well. One block to the beach and I assume at a lower rate. We were on the 15th floor, partial view of the water, it was great. Our room did have a slightly different configuration than our friends. Our bathroom was around a corner as opposed to being directly off the bedroom. Ours was better. Only problem when we were there was the escalator was being serviced causing confusion as to where we were meeting, lobby or street? Denny's located just around the corner was convenient for breakfast. Restaurant located in the hotel was okay. Average hotel and would definitely stay here again. Hotels have free buses that take you around the area.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Me and 2 friends just came back from our trip we stayed at Ohana East Hotel. It's on the perfect location! Just a block from Waikiki beach! Restaurants are beside it, one of the restaurants offers a cheap breakfast. The Employees are friendly and helpful. BUT the only downside is the walls are thin. On our first day while we were talking in a moderate voice somebody from the other room were banging the wall. So we were conscious every time we talk, we can not laugh out loud! Location wise? Yes I recommend it.
reviews.title: In Excellent Location

reviews.text: i have stayed at the Ohana East 3 times now and have enjoyed it everytime, the staff are so friendly and accomadating, From Norm at the bell desk who was so kind to us, i was travelling with my nephew and it was his first time in Hawaii, Norm was always talking with him and giving him the low down of the nightlife. The front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful, i will continue to stay at the ohana East each time i go to Hawaii. i also appreciate the added security at night it makes u feel that much more safer.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Ohana East a total of 9 times. I have stayed in both the standard and city-view rooms and have found both to be roomy, comfortable, clean, and much more than satisfactory. The service at this hotel is not only friendly and efficient, it is personal with a staff who are always reaching out to please guests to the very best of their abilities. From the moment of arrival with great bellmen (such as Raymond), to the front desk with charming and outgoing personalities (such as Meg and Denise), to the excellent housekeeping staff (such as Pik on the 17th floor), we couldn't ask for a better experience. The location, the amenities including free telephone calls, free trolley use, free high-speed internet, etc., all add up to a beautiful experience. The bonus is the very reasonable rate for such fine accommodations.
reviews.title: Ohana East is our Hawaiian home away from home!

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Ohana East many times, and the Outrigger East before that. We have always been treated with the utmost respect and appreciation. The rooms have always been priced reasonably, the ammenities are what was expected, and the guest service from the bell staff to the inside staff is unsurpassed anywhere and at any other property. We continue to stay at this location because we have been treated with such professionalism and care. The entire staff, Denise Torres, Tracy, Maili, Raymond, Jetson, and the rest, to numerous to mention, always make your stay as pleasant as humanly possible. We look forward to our visit for two to three weeks each year. Maholo.
reviews.title: Truly Ohana

reviews.text: The hotel itself is average, however, we had a great experience with the staff (especially Denise Torres) she made our stay very pleasant. Location was close enough to the beach for our short stay. Great restaurants close by - we really enjoye Duke's and Jimmy Buffet's & PF Changs and another Chinese Restaurant (Sea Garden ??).
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Hotel, Enjoyed it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine and the kitchenette was adequate for our purposes. It was close to everything we needed - and the free trolley shuttle was great.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: We stayed here for two weeks this past February as part of a pro-bowl vacation and it was a nice stay (not Fabulous) but nice.We had a few issues upon checking in the room, the bathroom needed to be re-cleaned and the closet in the bathroom seemed rather odd, the wait for the elevators seemed quite lengthy but we were just happy to be in Hawaii on vacation!
reviews.title: Basic but you're in Hawaii--not a hotel room.

reviews.text: We did request the following morning that our room be changed because trying to get ready with that closet in the bathroom proved more trying on our marriage than family holidays. The new room we were given was on a higher floor, had a nicer view, more spacious and was quieter since we were so far away from street level and the front desk staff were really lovely and helpful.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel- Overpriced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area was simple, plenty of lounge chairs, the bar staff could work on their people skills-one bar maid seemed like she had on "cranky pants" every time we saw her working, we stopped going to the bar and brought our own cocktails/sodas poolside instead.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Waikiki

reviews.text: The hotel is in a wonderful location, walking distance to everything and just one black from the beach!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Small bathroom, lack of a theromostat to control in-room temperature (only low,med,high air conditioning settings)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For what we would spend for one week at a "big name" hotel chain we stayed for TWO weeks at the OHANA and I'd prefer to spend more time in PARADISE than say "we're at the Hilton or the grand Hyatt (overrated by the way)".
reviews.title: Average hotel
Excellent Location
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Friendly staff, nice rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone says on the reviews, the bathroom is tiny, but who spends their holiday in the bathroom. This hotel is ideally located, one street from gorgeous Waikiki Beach and right in the heart of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Value Waikiki Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 7 nights in mid October at this hoteland for the price you will not find better value in Waikiki. Very good location, approx 4 mins walk to the beach Hotel was clean and well maintained with helpful staff who know the area very well. pool area is spacious and well maintained and big enough for the number of people who use it. Rooms clraned and made up every day.Loads of places to eat in the area, some even good value by Hawaii standards. Cost of parking a bit on the pricey side $15.00 per day but this is usual in Hawaii and you dont have to have a car in Waikiki. Dont think twice about using this Hotel and stick with the standard rooms as they have a bath with shower rather than just a small shower cubicle.
reviews.title: Dirty!!

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Ohana East Hotel in Waikiki in September.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay!

likes.liked: — CLEAN, friendly staff, kids loved pool

reviews.text: Because of a delayed flight we didn't get to the hotel until around midnight - we suspect this is why we ended up with a small dirty room in the corner of the hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!!!

reviews.text: I was very surprised with our accommodations. We have been traveling to Hawaii for over 30 years and have stayed at a variety of places and price ranges in Waikiki (Hilton Hawaiian Village, IIlikai Suites, Hyatt Regency, etc). However, this was to be a budget trip due to our traveling companions requirements.
reviews.title: Excellent value spot

reviews.text: We booked early and paid extra for the one bedroom suite on one of the top floors. Yes, the furniture is dated (It reminded me of early 70's bamboo white inspired motif). However, the king bedroom was large and the living room had a round table, sofa, some chairs, a small kitchen area with microwave, refrigerator, and an electric skillet. There were lanais that faced the mountains and the ocean. There was view of the ocean between the Hyatt's two towers. I was anticipating the much discussed small bathroom. However, in this unit there was a shower over the tub and enough room. After all, this is a moderate priced hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, but a little dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeepers were excellent. We did not use the air conditioning. There was a small table on the good sized lanai.
reviews.title: Ohana East

reviews.text: We ate out most meals. There is a clean, friendly, fast serving Denny's about a block and one half away. It has the regular budget menu. Coffee is $1 with an AARP card. The AARP card also gives you 20% discount during certain evening hours.
reviews.title: Amazing Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return. It is a central located clean hotel. We paid about $160 per night and this was well worth the cost. It is easy walking to most of Waikiki, with buses and trolley stops nearby.
reviews.title: Ohana East Hotel

reviews.text: Look this hotel is adequte but it is very basic accomodation. The postion is good really only one block from Waikiki and is well served by the bus line across the street. The rooms were clean the beds comfortable and the staff were average.
reviews.title: Ok but.....
Mandala0424
reviews.text: But this is a tired hotel with a poor pool area and the bathrooms are miniscule.

reviews.title: Worthy of another stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon in October and it was nice except for the fact he is 6'6 and 380lbs and the shower was very small. He could barely get into it we arent sure if it was because we had the kitchenette that they made the shower smaller but if you are big beware. The location was nice and had plenty of stores around it and the walk to the beach was quick and easy. We are looking to go back this November but we will not be staying in this hotel again just because of the shower size.

reviews.title: Great Hotel! Would recommend.
reviews.text: We visited the Ohana East on a Get Up and Go package with Fairfield resorts in July of 2006. The East was accomodating and check in was fast with no major problems. We were located on the 11th floor with a balcony overlooking the pool. (The room was reserved by Fairfield.) It was our honeymoon and a bottle of sparkling wine and two wine glasses were delivered to our room with a personalized note from the Ohana East staff. I was very impressed with this accomodation, especially because we booked with RCI/Fairfield and not the Ohana hotels.

reviews.title: Shopping Shopping Shopping
reviews.text: The location of this resort is great. It is only a few blocks from the beach and within a very short walk to many, many dining and entertainment choices. I would select this hotel again when planning a trip to Waikiki. The rooms were updated. The bathrooms (shower only) were clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Although not a resort or as luxurious, the accomodations were average and the hotel was well staffed.

We booked a hotel room/kitchenette for 6 nights in February 2006 and asked for a high floor to cut down on street noise per some previous reviews. We were given a room on the second floor and told that we could check in the morning for another room on a higher floor. Yes, everyone is right that the lower floors offer a lot of street noise. The next morning the staff obliged by giving us a room on the 17th floor which was pretty much the same as the previous room minus two stove top burners in our kitchenette. The room included a small refrigerator, microwave, a few plates, bowls, cups, and silverware, sink, queen bed, TINY bathroom, hair dryer and a safe for a small fee. The size of the bathroom didn’t bother me at first, but after day four it was getting on my nerves. The door would not open all the way because the toilet was in the way. If you wanted to use the bathroom, you had to maneuver around the door and then shut it. Luckily we are both small in stature (max of 5’9” and 150 lbs). Other than that issue, I was very satisfied with the hotel. The staff was very helpful and the concierge was a plus. Some other points to note are as follows:
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: - Pool only offered late day sun.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: - Internet café in the lobby opened until 2:00pm.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: - The hotel location was great. Short walk to the beach, grocery store, good restaurants and bus stop.
reviews.title: Poor Housekeeping but good neighborhood for Hotel

reviews.text: - Yes, there were hookers outside the hotel, but had I not read previous reviews, I probably wouldn’t have noticed them.
reviews.title: Hated this Place

reviews.text: Great location, right across Kalakaua from the beach. I was here using 4 free nights I had gotten from a timeshare deal. Let me say that this hotel was Ok, but I'm glad I didn't pay to stay there. When I go to Hawaii, it's to relax in a little more luxurious surroundings, but for free, I really can't complain.
reviews.title: Nice enough...

reviews.text: I'd heard that some of the rooms had been renovated, but mine surely (hopefully?) wasn't one of them. A/c worked ok...bed was a little firm, furnishings a little tired, but comfortable enough. I had a mini fridge, which was nice, My one big complaint is the shower! It opened into the toilet and only left a little over a foot of space to squeeze through. It was almost as if they designed the whole bathroom and at the last minute were like Oh Crap, we have to put a toilet in there too...oh well, nobody weighs over 200 pounds, right? -they can suck in their gut and make it into the shower. It was seriously that tight. And not that clean, either. :(
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The road behind the hotel was quite busy too...all night. I seemed to hear a LOT of garbage trucks!?!
reviews.title: Best hotel for the price in Waikiki!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also saw the room that the one guy was complaining about with the room service carts...it ended in 30. That was the only one available for early check-in and the lady gave me a key to go check it out to see if I wanted to wait for another one. I did wait because that room was kind of wedged in beside the elevators and down a little hallway that you shared with the service elevator. I could see where that would've been a pain.
reviews.title: Excellent no-frills hotel.

reviews.text: To sum it up, if you're looking to do Hawaii on a budget, this hotel would probably work for you...but I won't be staying here again.
reviews.title: Ideal for the budget and location in Waikiki!

reviews.text: Wow! Just returned from Waikiki and had a super time! We stayed at Ohana East for 2 nights before heading to Maui and I must admit I was pleasently surprised when we got here.
reviews.title: Location, location, location
Loved it
reviews.text: From reading other reviews I was anticipating a sub-par hotel in a good locale but found Ohana East to be great. Rooms were clean, roomy, had cold a/c and the location was fantastic. Sure there were other places much fancier but for this price point it was A DEAL. Yes, bathrooms had only a shower and the shower was small but still had more room than we needed, we were on the 4th floor and street noise was slight, not too much to keep you awake but a higher floor would be better if you sleep light.

reviews.title: Ohana East Hotel
reviews.text: Several places to eat are near by and the beach is a nice 5 min stroll from the lobby.
The room and the staff were great.
reviews.title: Great Location and Good Value

reviews.text: Parking is $15 a day but having a car more than made up for the cost of parking there.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ohana East hotel this past Memorial Day weekend. The best thing I can say about the hotel is that it has a great location, about 2 blocks from the beach. The hotel was also in walking distance to the International Marketplace as well as the shops on Lewers street.
reviews.title: Great Location in Waikiki
Great stay!!!
reviews.text: It is definitely not a new hotel and there is nothing to brag about, but the room was comfortable and had a partial ocean view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a no frills place to stay that is reasonably priced for a Waikiki location.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

likes.disliked: — Street noise at night, elevators slow at times

reviews.text: Myself, spouse, 16 yr old daughter and her best friend visited Waikiki/O'ahu April 2008. We rented a 1 bdrm kitchenette for 8 nights. It was a corner unit, great space, clean room/hotel, extremely friendly staff, very accomodating. Short walk(2 blocks) to the beach and very near shopping and International Marketplace. Only complaint...pullout sofabed mattress wasn' t all that comfortable. Good pricing. Overall great experience.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Was Happy Overall

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ohana East for 1 night at the beginning and 3 nights at the end of our vacation in November 2007.
reviews.title: Good Value for money

reviews.text: I stayed with some friends recently. We arrived in Honlolulu quite late due to a very very long delay in LAX.The taxi driver did not seem to know where this hotel was so we had some trouble trying to explain it.We finally arrived and checked in.The staff were at best average.The gentleman who served us seemed somewhat confused and check in was very slow.The room itself was an average size.We had a twin room on the 11th floor.Sadly my cityview room gave me a view of another building but no biggie.The only place I could find to put my luggage was in the closet which was tiny.The bathroom although small was adequate but the shower was very very tiny and even a small 5”5” female like me barely had enough room in it.The beds were comfy and the tv had plenty of channels to keep people amused.I must mention the lady in the cafe in the lobby.She was so friendly-she need to work in the hotel itself!The location of this hotel is excellent.Only a block away from the beach and local shopping which is very very cheap!Booked activities through the activity desk-staff there were very helpful and courteous.Overall a pleasent stay.Found it odd though that I got a local paper some days but not others and some days my room was made up others it wasn’t!
reviews.title: Average-nothing special!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Ohana East, the hotel is in a good position not too far from the beach. Good position for the buses and trolleys. Hotel itself is clean and comfortable. We paid extra to upgrade our room which partially overlooked the sea. On reflection I wish we had looked at the original room before paying the upgrade but it only cost us 10 dollars a night so it wasn't too bad. The only problem we had was with noisy neighbours who decided to party at 2 am in the morning!! We were a bit annoyed with the hotel staff who did not appear to have much power to stop the noise - it was left to another room to bang on their door in the middle of the night! We used the local buses to get to Pearl Harbour which was well worth the visit so I would suggest that you do it yourself as it is free when you get there. We also went all around the island for 2 dollars each(120 miles in all) you can also get off for up to 2 hours and not have to pay again as long as you ask for a transfer. Excellent value for money. Went to a beautiful beach at Hanauma Bay, again on the local bus, which is a conservation area. It is a great snorkelling area with not too many people on it because you have to pay 5 dollars to use it. Would deinitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good position, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ohana East Hotel, as many other reviewers have pointed out, is convenient to both shopping and the beach and several buses stop right outside the door for those wishing to use them to go to Pearl Harbor or downtown Honolulu. The front-desk staff are all uniformly friendly and efficient. That having been said, however, there is little else positive to note. Though the room rates are anything but cheap, the rooms themselves are small and cramped. There is a mini-refrigerator and one does get copies of the local newspaper every day (including Sunday) but no complimentary breakfast, which would have been nice, nor, indeed, any restaurant for anyone who might want it.
reviews.title: Adequate But
Great Location
reviews.text: Admittedly, neither my wife nor I had ever been to Honolulu before our recent trip so we have nothing with which to compare the Ohana East but surely there must be a good many better places to stay while one is in the city. Certainly if we are back again, we'll unquestionably try to find them.
This is my third trip to Honolulu and my first to the Ohana East, I usually stayed in Lewers Street but felt that I would like to try a different hotel and location.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will find this hotel a very good value and a perfect location.
reviews.title: Excellence in many ways

reviews.text: Very nice new room with plenty of furniture. Free internet in the room!
reviews.title: Can't Beat It for Location or Price

reviews.text: Spacious with a lanai.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good value but way too noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean, no bugs.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Clean and close to beach and restaurants

reviews.text: I recently stayed in a one bedroon suite with kitchenette for 11 nights at the Ohana East & was very impressed.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location......

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel mid morning & we were told our room was ready so the early check in was much appreciated after a 10hr flight with two young kids.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Honolulu

reviews.text: 2 short blocks to the beach, ABC stores, Food Pantry, restaurants & shops all surrounding the hotel. Bus & trolley stops also across the road.
reviews.title: Not one complaint!

reviews.text: Room was exactly as depicted on the hotel's website photos/video.
reviews.title: good place [central]

reviews.text: I had read past negative reviews regarding cleanliness & small showers but I had no problems- I know for a fact our room was vacuumed regularly & our shower roomy enough to fit myself & my two young girls together(maybe that depends on room type).
reviews.title: No complaints here
